Events.text: A Macedonian army led by Philip II defeated the combined forces of Athens and Thebes in the Battle of Chaeronea, securing Macedonian hegemony in Greece and the Aegean.
Events.html: A Macedonian army led by Philip II defeated the combined forces of Athens and Thebes in the Battle of Chaeronea, securing Macedonian hegemony in Greece and the Aegean.

Events.text: The Carthaginian army led by Hannibal defeats a numerically superior Roman army at the Battle of Cannae.
Events.html: The Carthaginian army led by Hannibal defeats a numerically superior Roman army at the Battle of Cannae.

Events.text: The armies of Titus destroy the Second Temple as the final blow of the Siege of Jerusalem.
Events.html: The armies of Titus destroy the Second Temple as the final blow of the Siege of Jerusalem.

Events.text: Majorian is arrested near Tortona (northern Italy) and deposed by the Suebian general Ricimer as puppet emperor.
Events.html: Majorian is arrested near Tortona (northern Italy) and deposed by the Suebian general Ricimer as puppet emperor.

Events.text: Edward I of England returns from the Ninth Crusade and is crowned King seventeen days later.
Events.html: Edward I of England returns from the Ninth Crusade and is crowned King seventeen days later.

Events.text: After the execution of her husband, Jeanne de Clisson sells her estates and raises a force of men with which to attack French shipping and ports.
Events.html: After the execution of her husband, Jeanne de Clisson sells her estates and raises a force of men with which to attack French shipping and ports.

Events.text: Russian troops are defeated by forces of the Blue Horde Khan Arapsha in the Battle on Pyana River.
Events.html: Russian troops are defeated by forces of the Blue Horde Khan Arapsha in the Battle on Pyana River.

Events.text: Thomas Grey, conspirator against King Henry V, beheaded.
Events.html: Thomas Grey, conspirator against King Henry V, beheaded.

Events.text: During Henry Hudson's search for the Northwest Passage, he sails into what is now known as Hudson Bay.
Events.html: During Henry Hudson's search for the Northwest Passage, he sails into what is now known as Hudson Bay.

Events.text: The signing of the United States Declaration of Independence took place.
Events.html: The signing of the United States Declaration of Independence took place.

Events.text: The first United States Census is conducted.
Events.html: The first United States Census is conducted.

Events.text: French Revolutionary Wars: The Battle of the Nile concludes in a British victory.
Events.html: French Revolutionary Wars: The Battle of the Nile concludes in a British victory.

Events.text: Charles X of France abdicates the throne in favor of his grandson Henri.
Events.html: Charles X of France abdicates the throne in favor of his grandson Henri.

Events.text: Japan's Edo society class system is abolished as part of the Meiji Restoration reforms.
Events.html: Japan's Edo society class system is abolished as part of the Meiji Restoration reforms.

Events.text: Tower Subway, the world's first underground tube railway, opens in London, England, United Kingdom.
Events.html: Tower Subway, the world's first underground tube railway, opens in London, England, United Kingdom.

Events.text: The Clay Street Hill Railroad begins operating the first cable car in San Francisco's famous cable car system.
Events.html: The Clay Street Hill Railroad begins operating the first cable car in San Francisco's famous cable car system.

Events.text: Anglo-Afghan War: The Siege of Malakand ends when a relief column is able to reach the British garrison in the Malakand states.
Events.html: Anglo-Afghan War: The Siege of Malakand ends when a relief column is able to reach the British garrison in the Malakand states.

Events.text: The Ilinden–Preobrazhenie Uprising against the Ottoman Empire begins.
Events.html: The Ilinden–Preobrazhenie Uprising against the Ottoman Empire begins.

Events.text: The German occupation of Luxembourg during World War I begins.
Events.html: The German occupation of Luxembourg during World War I begins.

links.title: German occupation of Luxembourg during World War I

Events.text: World War I: Austrian sabotage causes the sinking of the Italian battleship Leonardo da Vinci in Taranto.
Events.html: World War I: Austrian sabotage causes the sinking of the Italian battleship Leonardo da Vinci in Taranto.

Events.text: The first general strike in Canadian history takes place in Vancouver.
Events.html: The first general strike in Canadian history takes place in Vancouver.

Events.text: A typhoon hits Shantou, Republic of China killing more than 50,000 people.
Events.html: A typhoon hits Shantou, Republic of China killing more than 50,000 people.

Events.text: Vice President Calvin Coolidge becomes U.S. President upon the death of President Warren G. Harding.
Events.html: Vice President Calvin Coolidge becomes U.S. President upon the death of President Warren G. Harding.

Events.text: The positron (antiparticle of the electron) is discovered by Carl D. Anderson.
Events.html: The positron (antiparticle of the electron) is discovered by Carl D. Anderson.

Events.text: Gleichschaltung: Adolf Hitler becomes Führer of Germany following the death of President Paul von Hindenburg.
Events.html: Gleichschaltung: Adolf Hitler becomes Führer of Germany following the death of President Paul von Hindenburg.

Events.text: The Marihuana Tax Act of 1937 is passed in America, the effect of which is to render marijuana and all its by-products illegal.
Events.html: The Marihuana Tax Act of 1937 is passed in America, the effect of which is to render marijuana and all its by-products illegal.

Events.text: Albert Einstein and Leo Szilard write a letter to Franklin D. Roosevelt, urging him to begin the Manhattan Project to develop a nuclear weapon.
Events.html: Albert Einstein and Leo Szilard write a letter to Franklin D. Roosevelt, urging him to begin the Manhattan Project to develop a nuclear weapon.

Events.text: Jewish prisoners stage a revolt at Treblinka, one of the deadliest of Nazi death camps where approximately 900,000 persons were murdered in less than 18 months.
Events.html: Jewish prisoners stage a revolt at Treblinka, one of the deadliest of Nazi death camps where approximately 900,000 persons were murdered in less than 18 months.

Events.text: World War II: The Motor Torpedo Boat PT-109 is rammed by the Japanese destroyer Amagiri and sinks. Lt. John F. Kennedy, future U.S. President, saves all but two of his crew.
Events.html: 1943 – World War II: The Motor Torpedo Boat PT-109 is rammed by the Japanese destroyer Amagiri and sinks. Lt. John F. Kennedy, future U.S. President, saves all but two of his crew.

Events.text: ASNOM: Birth of the Socialist Republic of Macedonia, celebrated as Day of the Republic in the Republic of Macedonia.
Events.html: ASNOM: Birth of the Socialist Republic of Macedonia, celebrated as Day of the Republic in the Republic of Macedonia.

Events.text: World War II: The largest trade convoy of the world wars arrives safely in the Western Approaches.
Events.html: 1944 – World War II: The largest trade convoy of the world wars arrives safely in the Western Approaches.

Events.text: World War II: End of the Potsdam Conference.
Events.html: World War II: End of the Potsdam Conference.

Events.text: A British South American Airways Avro Lancastrian airliner crashes into a mountain during a flight from Buenos Aires, Argentina to Santiago, Chile. The wreckage would not be found until 1998.
Events.html: A British South American Airways Avro Lancastrian airliner crashes into a mountain during a flight from Buenos Aires, Argentina to Santiago, Chile. The wreckage would not be found until 1998.

links.title: 1947 BSAA Avro Lancastrian Star Dust accident

Events.text: An earthquake hits Casiguran, Aurora, Philippines killing more than 270 people and wounding 261.
Events.html: An earthquake hits Casiguran, Aurora, Philippines killing more than 270 people and wounding 261.

Events.text: A flash fire kills 51 people at the Summerland amusement centre at Douglas, Isle of Man.
Events.html: A flash fire kills 51 people at the Summerland amusement centre at Douglas, Isle of Man.

Events.text: A bomb explodes at the railway station in Bologna, Italy, killing 85 people and wounding more than 200.
Events.html: A bomb explodes at the railway station in Bologna, Italy, killing 85 people and wounding more than 200.

Events.text: Delta Air Lines Flight 191, a Lockheed L-1011 TriStar, crashes at Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport killing 137.
Events.html: Delta Air Lines Flight 191, a Lockheed L-1011 TriStar, crashes at Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport killing 137.

Events.text: Pakistan is re-admitted to the Commonwealth of Nations after having restored democracy for the first time since 1972.
Events.html: Pakistan is re-admitted to the Commonwealth of Nations after having restored democracy for the first time since 1972.

Events.text: A massacre is carried out by an Indian Peace Keeping Force in Sri Lanka killing 64 ethnic Tamil civilians.
Events.html: 1989 – A massacre is carried out by an Indian Peace Keeping Force in Sri Lanka killing 64 ethnic Tamil civilians.

Events.text: Iraq invades Kuwait, eventually leading to the Gulf War.
Events.html: Iraq invades Kuwait, eventually leading to the Gulf War.

Events.text: The Gaisal train disaster claims 285 lives in Assam, India.
Events.html: The Gaisal train disaster claims 285 lives in Assam, India.

Events.text: Air France Flight 358 lands at Toronto Pearson International Airport and runs off the runway, causing the plane to burst into flames leaving 12 injuries and no fatalities.
Events.html: Air France Flight 358 lands at Toronto Pearson International Airport and runs off the runway, causing the plane to burst into flames leaving 12 injuries and no fatalities.

Events.text: At least 146 people were killed and more than 114 injured in a factory explosion in Kunshan, Jiangsu, China.
Events.html: At least 146 people were killed and more than 114 injured in a factory explosion in Kunshan, Jiangsu, China.
